channel.title: Port-forward help
channel.description:
Okay, I'm trying to make a server, I CAN make it, it's just that I'm unable to forward my ports due to my router not being on any site.
If anyone can find it, my router is a
SIEMENS SpeedStream 6520
Thank you for reading. I hope you can help me. :(

item.title: Port-forward help
item.dc:creator: @masterp00n masterp00n
item.description:
@masterp00n wrote:

go to your default web browser and type 192.168.1.1.
there should be a box prompting you for username and pass leave username blank and pass admin and click ok to log on to your router
ok now Click the Security link near the top of the page
Wow Remove the checkmark from the Block Anonymous Internet Requests checkbox.

Click the Save Settings button near the bottom of the page.

Click the Applications & Gaming link near the top of the page.

You should now see a new menu. In this new menu, click Port Range Forward.

for applicatoin put your server name
for start and end put 43594
For protocl put tcp
for ip address is shoudl be your computers ip click my sig or click start then run then type cmd then type ipconfig then copy your ip address then place that on ip address then clikc enable
and you should be done
click save settings near the bottom

Read full topic

item.title: Port-forward help
item.dc:creator: @masterp00n masterp00n
item.description:
@masterp00n wrote:

Open your default web browser enter 10.0.0.138 in there ocne you are there a box should be prompting you for username and password by default bot username and password should be admin
unless your parents could of changed it
now Click the Security button near the left side of the page
then Click the Address Translation button near the center of the page
then Click the Configure link near the center of the page.
now Click the Add a custom By-Pass entry link near the bottom of the page.

Select service by name:

  • OR -
    Select Protocol:tcp and TCP/UDP port(s): -43594-43594
    Redirect selected protocol/service to IP Address: (put your computers ip address find it by clikc my sig or click start then run then type cmd then hit enter then type ipconfig and copy down your ip address not default gateway ok enter your ip address there)
    Go ahead and enter the settings shown above into the Add / Edit Entry menu and then click Apply.

Read full topic
